name: obscurely
content:
obscurely adverb
(NOT KNOWN)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not known about by many people: She died obscurely in her house in the country. They had lived obscurely in Illinois for forty years.
More examplesFewer examplesThe museum is obscurely tucked away in a residential district.She had written a few short stories, obscurely published in literary journals.He spurned fame and spent his life quietly and obscurely, in the wilds of Montana.

obscurely adverb
(NOT CLEAR)
in a way that is not clear or is difficult to understand or see: The official statement was obscurely worded. "You may not have to look far," Mike said, obscurely. See
obscure
More examplesFewer examplesShe was making me feel obscurely uneasy.It became obscurely difficult to determine who was to blame.He referred obscurely to a "sinister plot".He felt, obscurely, that this was some sort of warning.
